programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to the hills of Murrieta for an auction that has tensions and prices running high. Dave drives Darrell to breaking-point.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a 1920s car with wooden wheels and a ball and chain from Arizona's oldest prison.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is placed in a difficult position when a client offers him a set of Saddam Hussein's fingerprints, originally taken by the FBI.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick searches for a pair of 1920s petrol pumps, but a 1930s horse-gambling wheel catches his eye.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team returns a 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox to its former glory, while Rick makes a deal to buy a 1940s vending machine.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie's rescue team is presented with a mammoth task when a trailer of cat food bursts into flames. Meanwhile, Bruce gets into a fight that lands him in hospital. Documentary series following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team as it patrols Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: Daniel meets a human crash test dummy, witnesses an escapologist in action, and discovers from a Samurai warrior if it is possible to slice a bullet in half with a sword.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The mother of triplets is found dead in her Washington home, leaving detectives to piece together her final moments in the hope of revealing her killer's identity.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Armed with a budget of £1,000, the teams scour the scrapyards in search of fast cars such as Ferraris and Porsches. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions mount when a man loses his temper over a mix-up with his gold chain. Meanwhile, an allegedly cursed relic scares Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee shocks the family by turning violent, and Ashley loses her temper when someone tries to steal her underwear.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle go treasure hunting in Virginia, in search of bargains to stock their new shop.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Experts examine 'the promised land', which is considered the most sacred place on Earth. However, it has also been carved up and fought over for thousands of years.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates disturbingly similar stories of alien abductions from two different countries before tracking down some potential proof in Mexico.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick searches for a pair of 1920s petrol pumps, but a 1930s horse-gambling wheel catches his eye.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team returns a 1950s Wurlitzer jukebox to its former glory, while Rick makes a deal to buy a 1940s vending machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a torch from the 1984 Olympics, the world's smallest pistol and a 1937 car that may once have belonged to gangster Bugsy Siegel.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick risks buying a painting supposedly by Renaissance artist Albrecht Durer, but then has to ascertain if it is genuine. He also judges the value of a motorcycle.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey return to the auctions only to be greeted by fierce competition. Dave finds a piece of board game history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon have high hopes when they return to the site of one of their greatest triumphs, while the other bidders take on the self-proclaimed king of storage.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions mount when a man loses his temper over a mix-up with his gold chain. Meanwhile, an allegedly cursed relic scares Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee shocks the family by turning violent, and Ashley loses her temper when someone tries to steal her underwear.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four custom knifemakers compete to make the best usable knife through a series of challenges and bladesmiths craft the classic Greek Xiphos Sword.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Investigating the growing power and wealth of the US's super rich, including how billionaires' 'dark money' is being used to influence politics.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates rumours of human-alien genetic experiments reportedly going on deep below the New Mexico desert in an underground base.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Experts examine the many ancient Jewish and Christian documents that did not make it into the Bible, exploring why they were excluded.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and his father clash when Les's idea turns dangerous, and Ashley embarks on a new in-house business venture.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff fight over whether they should buy a batch of venomous reptiles, and an incident forces Les to seek a new head of security.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon fight over a piece of movie history, and Rene plans to make the other bidders pay dearly for coming to his home town.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Up the Ante in El Monte
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod try to outwit their rivals at an auction in El Monte, but face disaster if their plan backfires.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The captains have no choice but to head out into dangerously rough seas during a storm as the time continues to pass.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Truck driving fiancés Ash Bryant and Darryl Armfield are on a time critical job shifting 200 cattle over 500 kilometres of bush roads – but have they driven straight into trouble?.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: On the busiest travel week of the year, Al works to clear a burning trailer off the Coq and Colin rescues a delivery truck loaded with Christmas parcels.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene and Casey return to the auctions only to be greeted by fierce competition. Dave finds a piece of board game history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon have high hopes when they return to the site of one of their greatest triumphs, while the other bidders take on the self-proclaimed king of storage.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: With panellists Bill Bailey, Alan Davies, Andy Hamilton and Helen Atkinson-Wood. Stephen Fry poses questions on chimpanzees, chromosomes and cuttlefish, awarding points to the answers he finds most intriguing.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian and writer David Baddiel, former MP and Strictly Come Dancing 2016 star Ed Balls, stand-up and actress Jo Brand and ex-Pussycat Doll and Celebrity MasterChef 2015 winner Kimberly Wyatt join host Rob Brydon and captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Porridge star Mark Bonnar, actress Sheila Hancock, actor Stephen Mangan and radio and TV presenter Anita Rani join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Hannah Gadsby, Noel Fielding and Joe Lycett join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of pictures, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Melissa plays mind games with the group after being locked up for her own safety.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Todd and Tandy look into Melissa's past as they hunt for clues about her illness.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle become action sport film directors as they realise their dream of creating a Zombie vs Parkour chase scene.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys try to negotiate with a collector who demands a high price for every item up for sale, and check out a collection of Western memorabilia.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders in Lewes, East Sussex, where a vehicle sends bids sky high, John has spotted treasure, and Scotty and Dan play dirty.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Ipswich.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a 135-year-old opera house full of memorabilia, and try to negotiate with a fellow picker charging a high price for his merchandise.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The pickers find a reclusive collector hiding deep in the north woods of Maine and make a visit to the one-man village of Timtown.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Broadcasters Sue Perkins and Liza Tarbuck drive along the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a network of roads and paths in Southeast Asia that was littered with unexploded bombs following the Vietnam War. Their journey takes them through jungles and mountains to some of the least-explored corners of Laos and Vietnam, and proves to be a gruelling test of their bravery, motoring skills and senses of humour.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to impress Oxford residents by building an electric car, and refuse to let an unenthusiastic response deter them from sitting in on the machine's crash-test before handing it over to the Stig's environmentally friendly cousin. Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy Clarkson pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Bryan Jr builds an outdoor kitchen before hitting the beach in search of the ultimate driftwood bar.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Inspector Dave Corcoran calls on his friend to turn what looks like a tug boat into a police vessel. Meanwhile, the team fix up a car whose tyres were slashed whilst on duty.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the world's most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the show's new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Houston, Eddie faces the 'grim reaper' in a crawfish challenge featuring the fearsome reaper pepper. He also devours some southern comfort food and pulls a plane down a runway.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall follows in Rocky's footsteps with physical challenges at a famed Philadelphia boxing gym - and his very own hunger games in the infamous Philly Cheesesteak Challenge.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedian James Acaster, TV presenters Gabby Logan and Melvin Odoom and Cold Feet star Fay Ripley join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Countdown dictionary expert Susie Dent, comedian Bob Mortimer and TV presenters Ore Oduba and Stacey Solomon join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Linda Smith, Mark Gatiss and Sean Lock for more interesting answers on subjects including B major, B minor and B flat in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as Pointless co-presenter Richard Osman and comedians Romesh Ranganathan and Rachel Parris join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of picnics, with points being awarded not only for correct answers, but also for interesting ones.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: In the series finale, Noel Fielding finds an unlikely soul mate, Lolly Adefope shows everyone the money, and Mel Giedroyc bites off more than she can chew.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain presents a special compilation show featuring previously unbroadcast material, out-takes and favourite bits from the recent series of the satirical comedy quiz, when regular panellists Andy Parsons and Hugh Dennis were joined by guests including Rob Beckett, Miles Jupp, Romesh Ranganathan, Ed Byrne and Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists John Sessions, Mark Steel, Clive Anderson and Alan Davies answer questions on corks, cats and carbon dioxide, with host Stephen Fry awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Past
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of Thomas Beale's Treasure
programme.desc: Documentary highlighting the search for treasures believed to have been buried by Thomas Beale in Colorado's Blue Ridge Mountains, and the mission by brothers Clayton and George Hart in 1897 to crack the ciphers left by Beale that allegedly reveal the location of the hoard. However, the siblings never solved the code, and a century later many question whether the story of Beale's treasure is just an elaborate hoax.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team explore a site at Brancaster in Norfolk that is believed to have been a Roman 'shore fort', and possibly a key military outpost. They amass 2,500 finds - their biggest-ever haul - which provide information on contemporary decorative arts, sport and much more, and also undertake a high-definition geophysics survey that generates enough data to crash the computers. The biggest surprise reveals evidence of a high level of trade with the local population, and clues as to how Britons living near the site benefited financially from the Roman presence.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate an Iron Age hill fort in Cardiff that dominates a city housing estate, and explore whether the site could be the long-lost ancient capital of south Wales. With five acres of ground and half a mile of ramparts and ditches to examine, time is not on their side, but, helped by the local community, finds such as the remains of jewellery and drinking vessels help paint a vivid picture of domestic life around 800BC.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Viking Burial Shops of Estonia
programme.desc: Experts analyse the remains of two Viking boats, that were filled with dead bodies.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How the most incredible bridges from around the world help to solve a series of spanning problems. Featuring the world's longest single-span box girder bridge in Wales.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate an Iron Age hill fort in Cardiff that dominates a city housing estate, and explore whether the site could be the long-lost ancient capital of south Wales. With five acres of ground and half a mile of ramparts and ditches to examine, time is not on their side, but, helped by the local community, finds such as the remains of jewellery and drinking vessels help paint a vivid picture of domestic life around 800BC.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that 'talk' to bees using electrical signals.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough tells the tale of winged insects, witnessing mayflies emerging from their larval cases in central Hungary and purple crow butterflies in the valleys of Taiwan. Slow-motion cameras reveal the incredible flight skills that enable the creatures to find new territories and sources of food. The aeronautical tricks employed by heavier insects such as bees and beetles are also revealed.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Examining a fleet of cruise ships that are the largest passenger vessels in the world, and revealing how they have built on 19th-century experiments in hydrodynamics.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Viking Burial Shops of Estonia
programme.desc: Experts analyse the remains of two Viking boats, that were filled with dead bodies.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The daring engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville changes his image with the help of some trendy clothes and a medallion made from a cocoa tin lid, while Arkwright decides to increase his profits through advertising.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki and Jack are called to a petrol station where three people have been shot dead, and conclude it is the work of a concealed shooter working from long range - a sniper is at large in London. They combine ballistics and wound pathology with the killer-profiling skills of senior investigator DCI Jane De Freitas, as they work to find this seemingly random murderer before panic hits the city. Starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Zoe Telford and Steve Wall.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.sub-title: This is Not a Love Song
programme.desc: Hugh and Penny are forced together during an overnight trip to a coal mine, and Meryl turns failure into success when she unveils a new statue to commemorate the town.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh decides to tell Ajax the truth about their relationship, against his family's advice, but it does not go as planned.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters launch their spring collection for working women to much acclaim, which leads to Beatrice and Evie receiving an offer that has both business and personal consequences. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave, Paddy, Tony and Luke plan a wild night out in Amsterdam, and Captain Keiron Voce and Kate Butler finally voice their feelings for each other.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers carry out a series of exercises in evacuating casualties from a combat zone, which leaves them convinced they are about to be sent on active duty.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie fails in her latest attempt to seduce Will, but has much more success with Mubbs. Lisa is furious to find Mickie, Donna and Jess having a party at their flat, while a patient's wife is horrified to discover her husband is having an affair. Terri Dwyer guest stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As June and Jim prepare to tie the knot, the past threatens to catch up with both of them and shatter their happiness. Evil Gabriel plays mind games with the pair, suggesting the marriage is merely a sham, while Jim's drunken ex-wife Marie makes an unscheduled appearance - but will love conquer all? The romance of the occasion goes to Reg and Marilyn's heads, while back at the station, Adam gets lured into a trap that could destroy his career.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Still working undercover, Kerry gets in way over her head after witnessing the death of a Radford escort girl and being ordered to give one of the others a beating, and Rob begins to fear the worst when she goes for days without reporting back. As Neil's relationship with Andrea blossoms, he lets slip some of his most closely guarded secrets about his colleagues - not least big cheese Adam Okaro - which soon end up on the front pages of the newspapers. Gina is distraught to discover Jonathan has requested a transfer to another station.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A mystery man arrives in Albert Square, on the lookout for Mark Fowler.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sparks fly when Michelle challenges Mark over their quest to clear Clyde's name.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A businessman in the process of running away with his mistress falls down a lift shaft, suffering severe injuries to his spine. His wife and lover later confront each other in the Holby wards. Daniel returns to work following his breakdown and confesses to colleagues his heart is no longer in the job, while Baz accepts Charlie's invitation to supper.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim investigates a Belgian stable girl living a life of inexplicable luxury and uncovers a killer in the process. John Nettles plays the Jersey-based detective.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Festive edition of the comedy from 1991, in which Foggy is convinced Compo's trousers are out of control and Clegg believes them to be haunted. Starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.sub-title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo Clock
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2005. The south Londoners' dreams of joining the country set come one step closer when they attend the Royal Agricultural Ball, where they are introduced to titled gentry Rupert and Jonty, who tempt Boycie to invest in a new polo club - and things get even better when they're invited to spend Christmas in St Moritz to finalise the deal. However, before they can set off for the airport, a heavy snowfall traps the family and the staff at the farm for the entire festive season - just as two shady-looking characters arrive on the scene. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: A festive special of John Sullivan's sitcom from 2006. Jed, Elgin and Bryan become convinced a mythical creature is stalking Winterdown Farm, and Llewellyn accuses the Boyces' dog of seducing his pedigree collie. Meanwhile, Beth is set for a Christmas surprise and Tyler spreads a rumour that Mrs Cakeworthy is pregnant - a revelation that comes as quite a shock to her husband, as they have not been intimate for some time. Nigel Harrison and Paul Bown guest star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detectives' case against a violent criminal is thrown into jeopardy by the murder of a key witness. Determined to secure a conviction, they immerse themselves in the seedy underworld of a seaside town, and as they press for answers, Havers is brought face to face with her childhood memories. Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: After Sandra's departure, the detectives are anxious to meet their new boss, and DCI Sasha Miller wastes no time getting cracking with her first Ucos case, the murder of an Italian immigrant on a west London allotment 25 years earlier. The ritualistic style of the killing puts one of the other gardeners in the frame when it's revealed he is a practising druid. However, as the investigation continues, Gerry becomes suspicious of Sasha - why is she kissing a senior officer? Tamzin Outhwaite joins the cast as DCI Miller, with Dennis Waterman, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. Nikki and Jack investigate when a man is run down and killed by a Tube train - although not long after, a female vicar is murdered on the Underground, leaving them with the difficult prospect of building a case against her distraught husband. However, when a young roofer is stalked and brutally killed on his journey home, CCTV cameras pick up a suspect who links the deaths, and a full-scale manhunt is launched. Meanwhile, Nikki forms a bond with one of the detectives, who asks her to help re-evaluate his father's murder when he was a child. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star.

programme.desc: Adam Boulton tackles post-Brexit politics with probing interviews and passionate debate about the big issues of our time.

programme.title: Brothers in Football
programme.desc: Following south London amateur football team Corinthian-Casuals as they travel to Sao Paulo in Brazil to fulfil a tour abandoned 100 years before on the eve of the First World War, facing two-time FIFA Club World Cup-winners SC Corinthians Paulista. The documentary also commemorates the original Corinthian FC, a club credited with popularising the sport around the world.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill presents more mishaps caught on camera. A camel smashes a car window, a runaway speedboat causes a traffic accident and a drummer is crushed by a crucifix in church.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson presents the show from the Devonshire Dome in Buxton, where finds brought in for auction include the death mask of romantic poet John Keats, an unusual corkscrew, and an art deco diamond watch.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain is infuriated by his family's actions, Leyla covers her feelings, while Billy and Dawn reconcile.

programme.title: Sean's Festive Scotland
programme.desc: Sean Batty goes on a winter road trip, celebrating Scotland at the most wonderful time of the year.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter takes a look at the best Christmas deals on food and drink. The stars of The Real Housewives of Cheshire take a blind taste test to see if they can tell the difference between supermarket sparkling wine and real champagne. Mother and daughter Janet Ellis and Sophie Ellis-Bextor get to grips with some 1970s-style retro kitchen appliances, and Matt Tebbutt samples Phillip's efforts with a DIY home gin-making kit.

programme.title: Sticks and Stones
programme.desc: Thomas feels under pressure to succeed in all aspects of his life, so arranges three vitally important encounters on the same night. First he attempts to ingratiate himself with his boss over a drink, then tries to persuade an old friend to become a new client, and finally has dinner with his father-in-law. However, his attempt to do too much has terrible consequences, causing his life to spiral even further out of control.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: The Dirty War on the NHS
programme.desc: Documentary examining plans to sell off the National Health Service. The film explores the history of the world's first people's health service and how it has provided a vital safety net to generation of people, and examines efforts to introduce an insurance-based healthcare system, which in the US, has denied vital medical treatment to millions of people. Filmed in both countries, the film warns of danger to the fundamental human right to medical care.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The mining of precious opals beneath a hot desert, the making of nougat and how stunt planes are built.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a cheap BMW M5 in a terrible condition, and Edd China has his work cut out trying to rejuvenate the dilapidated vehicle so it can turn a profit.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Resident barman and brainbox, national institution and know-it-all Shaun Williamson joins the comedian as he invites teams from across the UK to compete in a traditional British pub quiz. In the first show, Phill Jupitus and Kerry Godliman take up the reins as guest team captains in a battle between The George from Lancaster and The Pavilion End from London.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A fire causes red-hot metal shrapnel to rain over Dallas, a motorcycle daredevil survives a 200mph crash and a car is thrown half a mile by a huge explosion.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A helicopter co-pilot fights for his life after a crash, a man loses control of his powerboat at 125mph and a tanker blaze soon becomes a fireball.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Bobby hopes to expand the business but is wary of making major purchases, while Joy has to deal with a broken truck, a permit crisis and 45-ton grinder.

programme.title: Overhaulin' Chronicles
programme.desc: Chip and the A-team design and overhaul Efrain Nieto's Olds 442 - will he be pleased with their handiwork?.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Bureau's quest to identify members of terrorist group Omega 7, whose crimes include bombings and assassinations including that of Cuban refugee leader Eulalio Jose Negrin.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into the work of toxicologists, who use blood and tissue samples to solve gruesome murder cases.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Michelle Thornton, who disappeared on December 30, 2010. Footage from surveillance cameras in her building, plus fingerprints and DNA evidence led police to known felon Gary Wade.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of mother and daughter Angela and Ashley Hyke who went missing in July 2001, leaving candles burning and electric fans running in their home. Days later their bodies were found in shallow graves. Authorities quickly recognised that the key to identifying the murderer might lie in Angela's diary.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Atlanta Prison riots of November 1987, which broke out when the US struck a deal with Cuba to repatriate up to 2,500 refugees held at the facility. The uprising lasted 11 days, involved more than 100 hostages, and saw a substantial portion of the prison destroyed by fire.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team rescues 30 dogs living in crowded and dirty conditions at a scrapyard in the desert.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a dog with a growth on its leg. However, after a thorough examination he finds a second lump in its mammary glands that could prove to be more sinister.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dina is ready to try on her dress, while Carla disagrees with her mother over how revealing her gown should be.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Even after gaining confidence from losing weight, Victoria still seeks her mother's approval on her dress, while Lauren and her mum disagree on styles of gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A former beauty queen wants to put her old style behind her, while a woman getting married for the second time wants a gown that will be the centre of attention.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown takes in a kitten with broken legs, and an orphaned goat in need of some help.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A pair of peregrine falcons and a rabbit with a high libido receive help from Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Officers are alerted to a Siberian tiger cooped up in a trailer, and deal with a house containing more than 30 cats living together in poor conditions. The police investigate a case of horse neglect and examine sick and injured poodles.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Jim Boller and his team are given an unusual and potentially hazardous task - moving four black bears from a roadside zoo to their secure shelter.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades saves a battered suitcase, a wingback chair and a Formica table top from the recycling centre, and tries to transform them with the help of Daniel Heath and Ray Clarke.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Exploring the mind of an obsessive murderer, following the work of psychologists as they study the often confused workings of the criminal psyche.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of 28 year-old bride-to-be Marilyn 'Niqui' McCown, who disappeared after visiting a laundromat near her home in Richmond, Indiana in July 2001. To add to the mystery, four months later Niqui's abandoned truck was found 40 miles away.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Tim Carney, who vanished on his way to church for morning prayers. The mystery deepened when his car was later retrieved from the airport and his bank account found to have been almost emptied.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Tinnell had already found her dream dress, but didn't buy it because she wanted to stay within her budget, while Tykesha's outspoken daughter is a tough customer.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Julie misses her mum, but is staying positive that she will find the perfect dress. Meanwhile, Emily has tried on 20 gowns and is hoping Lori can help her find the perfect one.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Here Comes the Bride - and Her Bride
programme.desc: Brooke has her hands full with two brides, one of whom is looking for her dream gown, while Savannah wants a traditional Southern theme.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Jennifer puts her budget-conscious father in a cold sweat, while Manette is convinced a gown she already put a deposit on is the one for her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A soon-to-be-married woman's best friend is furious about her decision to appoint a man as her 'male of honour'.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride sets out to find a green dress that matches her emerald engagement ring, and to complicate matters she is determined it has to be the exact same shade.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.sub-title: Big Bridal Bumps in the Road
programme.desc: Heather's wedding is taking place on the Love Boat and her dress needs to include feathers. Plus, Marissa encounters a challenge during her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A bride has dreamed about walking down the aisle in a dress with a detachable shirt since she was a little girl, and it falls to the team to make it happen.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard hopes to strike a deal on a visit to a 900-year-old abbey in Somerset, before he takes a trip down memory lane at a pedal museum in East Sussex.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades saves a battered suitcase, a wingback chair and a Formica table top from the recycling centre, and tries to transform them with the help of Daniel Heath and Ray Clarke.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A grieving mother has gastric bypass surgery to reduce her weight, but now has to confront the emotional issues that cause her to overeat.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Doctors Christian Jessen, Dawn Harper and Pixie McKenna deal with the impact obesity can have on fertility, and excess hair caused by polycystic ovaries. There is also advice for a man concerned about the size of his chest.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Born with Two Heads: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: The programme uncovering stories of rare medical conditions visits Afghanistan, where doctors operate on a baby born with a parasitic tumour.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for the FALN terrorist group, who were suspected of setting off several bombs across America during the 1970s and 1980s.
